column1: The '''Foreword''' is the very first section appearing in '''''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'''''.

In the Foreword to the first edition of ''The Lord of the Rings'',<ref group=note>Reprinted in "greater part" in ''[[The Peoples of Middle-earth]]'' (pp. 25-6), and in its entirety in ''[[The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion]]'' (pp. lxviii-lxx).</ref> Tolkien imposes himself as merely translator and editor of the text to come, thus sharing the [[legendarium
column2: in-universe]] character of the 1951 [[The Hobbit Preface
column3: prefatory note]] to the second edition of ''[[The Hobbit]]''.

column1: In the Foreword to the second edition of ''The Lord of the Rings'', first published in 1965,<ref group=note>The second edition Foreword first appeared in the 1965 edition of ''The Lord of the Rings'' published by [[Ballantine Books]], partly in response to the [[Ace Books]] controversy.</ref> Tolkien possibly revised the in-universe perspective,<ref>{{HM
